message.content:
1. VRS scores did not significantly differ between the morphine and tramadol treated groups postoperatively.
2. There was a difference in the one-hour post-operative scores between the morphine and tramadol treated groups.
3. The tramadol-treated group experienced less pain one hour post-operatively.
4. The difference in pain experienced by the tramadol-treated group one hour post-operatively was statistically significant (P < 0.007).

messages.content:
Statement: Meanwhile, VRS scores did not differ significantly between the morphine and tramadol treated groups postoperatively, except for in the one-hour post-operative scores in which the tramadol-treated group experienced less pain (P < 0.007).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
